text.p: Grain and oilseed exports reported by USDA and private export sources.
CORN SALE - Private exporters reported to the Agriculture Department export sales of 105,000 tonnes of corn for delivery to unknown destinations during the 1996/97 marketing year.
SOY AND CORN TENDER - Taiwan may tender up to 92,000 tonnes of soybeans and 16,000 tonnes of corn this week.
SOYBEAN TENDERS - South Korea's state-run Agricultural and Fishery Marketing Corp has invited offers for 40,000 tonnes of No.1 soybeans. Bidding will close on May 15.

SOYBEAN TENDERS - Japanese buyers will be picking up U.S. soybeans for July shipment this week due to firmer quotes seen on U.S. Gulf/Japan freight rates, traders said. "End-users returned to the market since last week and are watching the freight cost across the Pacific Ocean," a soybean trader at a major trade house in Japan said.

SOYMEAL TENDER - El Salvador was retendering for about 8,000 to 10,000 tonnes U.S. soybean meal under the PL-480 export program for June 1-15, July 1-31 and/or August 1-31 delivery. Offers were to be submitted no later than May 12 and will be valid until May 13.
WHEAT TENDERS - Tunisia issued a tender for the purchase of five lots of 25,000 tonnes of soft wheat each, traders said. Deadline to submit offers is set for May 14.

WHEAT TENDERS - Sri Lanka seeks 100,000 tonnes HRW wheat in two lots of 50,000 tonnes. Tenders close on May 16. The first shipment was for May 22-June 5 if from U.S., Canada, Europe or Argentina, and June 10-19 from Australia or Saudi Arabia. The second lot was for June 16-25 if from U.S., Canada, Continent or Argentina, and June 30-July 9 from Australia or Saudi Arabia.

WHEAT TENDERS - Taiwan will seek a total of 113,000 tonnes U.S. wheat in two separate tenders, several exporters said. One tender for 61,000 tonnes will be issued on May 13 and another for 52,000 tonnes will come out May 14, several U.S. exporters said.
FLOUR TENDER - Yemen seeks 150,000 tonnes of soft wheat flour on May 13 for August/October shipment. The flour was expected to come from the EU, U.S. or both.
BARLEY TENDER - Cyprus seeks 25,000 tonnes of barley on May 13 for May/June shipment.

LENTIL TENDER - Syria's General Establishment for Cereal Processing and Trade offered 16,000 tonnes of lentils for export. An international call for prices set May 20 as the final date to receive bids, confirmation May 21.

SUNOIL TENDER - The CCC tendered on May 7 for 3,000 tonnes of U.S. crude sunflower seed oil for export to Mozambique, June 1-20 shipment. CCC also seeks 2,000 tonnes refined U.S. sunflower seed oil for donation under its export program to Bosnia. Offers are due on May 13.
RICE TENDER - Jordan seeks 15,000 tonnes of medium grain camolina type rice on May 21 for June delivery

MARKET TALK - The U.N. has now approved the sale of a total of 400,000 tonnes of French soft wheat to Iraq under a U.N. monitored oil-for-food pact, a French government source said. The last count on April 4 showed the total at 325,000 tonnes. The latest approvals were given by U.N. authorities on April 28, the source said.
...Costa Rican millers bought late Friday in a private tender 26,500 tonnes Argentine or U.S. long grain rough rice at sellers' option for June 30-July 7 shipment, one U.S. exporter said.
